item.title: Zuni Indian Tribe Water Rights Settlement Act of 2003
Grand Teton National Park Land Exchange Act

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 229 - 175 (Roll no. 245). (text: CR H5012)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 229 - 175 (Roll no. 245).(text: CR H5012)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 194 (Roll no. 244).
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 258.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5012-5022)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 57.

S. 222 shall be debatable 40 minutes equally divided between the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on Resources. Waives all points of order against consideration of S.222. Provides one motion to recommit, with or without instructions, for S. 222. The rule further provides that S. 273 shall be debatable for 40 minutes equally divided between the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on Resources. Waives all points of order against consideration of S. 273. Finally, the rule provides one motion to recommit,
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-140, by Mr. Hastings (WA).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-140, by Mr. Hastings (WA).

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of S. 222 (Zuni Indian Tribe water rights settlement) and S.273 (Grand Teton National Park Land acquisition).

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced on June 4, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Sets forth the rule for the consideration of S. 222 (Zuni Indian Tribe water rights settlement) and S.273 (Grand Teton National Park Land acquisition).

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced on June 4, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Sets forth the rule for the consideration of S. 222 (Zuni Indian Tribe water rights settlement) and S.273 (Grand Teton National Park Land acquisition).

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (S. 222) to approve the settlement of the water rights claims of the Zuni Indian Tribe in Apache County, Arizona, and for other purposes, and for consideration of the bill (S. 273) to provide for the expeditious completion of the acquisition of land owned by the State of Wyoming within the boundaries of Grand Teton National Park, and for other purposes.

item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (S. 222) to approve the settlement of the water rights claims of the Zuni Indian Tribe in Apache County, Arizona, and for other purposes, and for consideration of the bill (S. 273) to provide for the expeditious completion of the acquisition of land owned by the State of Wyoming within the boundaries of Grand Teton National Park, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (S. 222) to approve the settlement of the water rights claims of the Zuni Indian Tribe in Apache County, Arizona, and for other purposes, and for consideration of the bill (S. 273) to provide for the expeditious completion of the acquisition of land owned by the State of Wyoming within the boundaries of Grand Teton National Park, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
